page.title: 09ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: The village hall with a capacity for not more than 70 people, is used for a Youth Club, Women's Institute, Yoga classes,occasional discotheques and private parties. The Poacher, the only Public House in the village, provides entertainment in the form of darts' matches and annual open air theatre. Teams are also organised for inter village raft and bed races. The Somershey Theatre, inaugurated in 1985, has risen from a barn in a cottage garden. So far productions have been for solo actors, with aprofessional assisted by local amateurs. Weather permitting, fetes, garden parties & carnivals abound. The local harrier hunt meet in the village at least twice a year. Both the church & community council produce magazines for education & entertainment. Further attractions are on notice boards.
